author: Rigveda
author_description: The Rigveda is an ancient Indian collection of Vedic Sanskrit hymns. It is one of the four sacred canonical texts of Hinduism known as the Vedas.

author: Yajurveda
author_description: The Yajurveda is one of the four main texts of Hinduism's Vedic period, containing prose mantras for worship rituals.

author: Atharvaveda
author_description: The Atharvaveda is the fourth Veda, focusing on everyday life, healing practices and metaphysical knowledge.

author: Buddha
author_description: Siddhartha Gautama, known as the Buddha, was a spiritual teacher who founded Buddhism. His journey to enlightenment began in ancient India, around the 5th century BCE. Born into a royal family, Siddhartha lived a life of luxury until he encountered the harsh realities of life outside the palace. These encounters with old age, sickness, and death deeply troubled him and set him on a quest for understanding and inner peace. At the age of 29, Siddhartha renounced his royal privileges and embarked on a spiritual journey. He practiced severe asceticism, seeking spiritual awakening through extreme self-denial. However, he eventually realized that neither the indulgent life of the palace nor the severe ascetic practices were the path to enlightenment. Instead, he discovered the Middle Wayâ€”a path of moderation and balance.

author: Lord Krishna
author_description: Krishna is a major deity in Hinduism and the speaker of the Bhagavad Gita.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
author_description: Seneca was a Roman Stoic philosopher, statesman, and dramatist. He was a tutor and advisor to emperor Nero, known for his writings on ethics and natural phenomena.
